article.headline: Alabama St. 81, Texas Southern 68
article.story: MONTGOMERY, Ala. (AP) -- Andrew Hayles and Joel Bosh both scored 15 points in helping Alabama State make easy work of Texas Southern Saturday and glide to a 81-68 victory. Bosh put the Hornets (11-7, 7-1 Southwestern Athletic Conference) on the board with a 3-pointer seconds into the game and Alabama State never looked back. Texas Southern (4-17, 3-5) trailed 40-25 at the half after shooting 45 percent from the field compared to Alabama State's 60 percent shooting. Rashad Provitt scored 11 points for the Hornets and Jamarr Sanders followed with 10 while Roland Fitch had a game-high seven rebounds. Texas Southern's Sollie Norwood led all players with 19 points and David Burrell added 12. Damian Henderson rounded out the double-digit scoring for the Tigers with 10.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
